Any idea's how i could find ou why this: Tryed normal cd, normal alt cd, tryed windows install, nothign nothing nothing
Does it even begin to boot from the cdrom ?
Sounds like it can't understand where the cdrom is or how to use it.

It begins to boot, then when it comes time to load the live filesystem, it can't find a device to load it from. This sometimes happens on SATA cdroms for instance, where the chipset driver for the SATA controller is not loaded into the initrd of the kernel
You may have in your bios an option where all the sata drives can be seen as traditional IDE types. If so perhaps try this and see if the cd loads further
